page.title: 05FARMING LOCALLY
page.content: A local farmer and his wife gave the following information about their farm. They own 480 acres of farm land with 95 young beef cattle, 210 sheep, 4 horses and some ducks. They use their cows for meat only. The best harvest was in 1984. The average rainfall for this area is only 20-25 inches per year. This is the lowest rainfall in Britain. The crops that are grown on this farm are wheat, barley, oilseed rape, sugar beet, potatoes and grass for hay. All these crops are very important to the farmer, they are all needed as much as each other. They use 4 labourers on the farm. The workers are used for mending fences and machinery. They have 4 tractors, 1 combine-baler, a potato planter, potato lifter, some drills, a sugarbeet lifter, ploughs, harrows and a potato riddle.
